trans-unit.source: Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: Document BOM

trans-unit.source: The document BOM is always presented as a “Resource List,” which is a multilevel BOM that includes items and capacities like Work Centers, Work Center Groups and Resources.

seg-source.mrk: The document BOM is always presented as a “Resource List,” which is a multilevel BOM that includes items and capacities like Work Centers, Work Center Groups and Resources.

trans-unit.source: : Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Document BOM

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Document BOM page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Document BOM page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Delete Status

seg-source.mrk: Delete Status

trans-unit.source: Required for the PDM interface to the “ProfiDB” system. The field indicates that the item marked in the PDM system’s BOM has been deleted.

seg-source.mrk: Required for the PDM interface to the “ProfiDB” system.
The field indicates that the item marked in the PDM system’s BOM has been deleted.

trans-unit.source: Entry No.

seg-source.mrk: Entry No.

trans-unit.source: Number of the BOM line. The number is automatically assigned by the system and cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: Number of the BOM line.
The number is automatically assigned by the system and cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Belongs to Entry No.

seg-source.mrk: Belongs to Entry No.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the higher-level BOM item to which the current line belongs. The field cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the higher-level BOM item to which the current line belongs.
The field cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Level Line No.

seg-source.mrk: Level Line No.

trans-unit.source: Sequential numbering of all BOM lines in a level. The field cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: Sequential numbering of all BOM lines in a level.
The field cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Level

seg-source.mrk: Level

trans-unit.source: Specifies the level of the BOM structure to which the line is assigned. The number is automatically assigned by the system and cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the level of the BOM structure to which the line is assigned.
The number is automatically assigned by the system and cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Status

seg-source.mrk: Status

trans-unit.source: Specifies the status of the BOM line, which controls whether the current line is recognized as included in supply planning by the system (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="General FastTab.htm#_Ref406771348" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“General FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) or whether a production order can be generated.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the status of the BOM line, which controls whether the current line is recognized as included in supply planning by the system (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="General FastTab.htm#_Ref406771348" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“General FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) or whether a production order can be generated.

trans-unit.source: Open – Lines with this status are neither included in supply planning (can be set in the Configure to Order Setup page), nor can a production order be generated via open lines.

seg-source.mrk: Open – Lines with this status are neither included in supply planning (can be set in the Configure to Order Setup page), nor can a production order be generated via open lines.

trans-unit.source: Released – Lines with this status are included in supply planning if this is defined in the Configure to Order Setup page. A production order can be generated via released lines.

seg-source.mrk: Released – Lines with this status are included in supply planning if this is defined in the Configure to Order Setup page.
A production order can be generated via released lines.

trans-unit.source: Closed –This status must be set manually.

seg-source.mrk: Closed –This status must be set manually.

trans-unit.source: Separate Prod. Order

seg-source.mrk: Separate Prod.
Order

trans-unit.source: Defaults from the Item Card or the master BOM and can be changed here if required. This field controls whether a separate production order is created for this line when a production order is generated (by clicking Create Separate Prod. Order on the ribbon).

seg-source.mrk: Defaults from the Item Card or the master BOM and can be changed here if required.
This field controls whether a separate production order is created for this line when a production order is generated (by clicking <span class="Bold">Create Separate Prod.
Order on the ribbon).

trans-unit.source: Position, Position 2 and Position 3

seg-source.mrk: Position, Position 2 and Position 3

trans-unit.source: Specifies the position number. These fields are used to enter the drawing position numbers of an associated CAD or design drawing.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the position number.
These fields are used to enter the drawing position numbers of an associated CAD or design drawing.

trans-unit.source: Type

seg-source.mrk: Type

trans-unit.source: Selects the type of BOM line. The following options are available:

seg-source.mrk: Selects the type of BOM line.
The following options are available:

trans-unit.source: <blank> – Used mainly to insert a comment in a manufacturing BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: <blank> – Used mainly to insert a comment in a manufacturing BOM line.

trans-unit.source: Account (G/L) – Currently has no functionality.

seg-source.mrk: Account (G/L) – Currently has no functionality.

trans-unit.source:
Item – Enables an item from the item master to be entered as a BOM component.
  • When an item has a master BOM itself, this is taken into consideration automatically and transferred to the document BOM if the Part Type field is set to Production in the item master. When an item is entered manually and if it has its own master BOM, this can be transferred to the document BOM by clicking Request BOM from Line from the ribbon.
  • If the Part Type field is set to Standard, then the item is treated as in the standard.
  • If the Part Type field is set to Purchase and the status of a Document BOM changes to Released, a new Variant Code gets inserted to the Variant Code field in the BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: Item – Enables an item from the item master to be entered as a BOM component.
• When an item has a master BOM itself, this is taken into consideration automatically and transferred to the document BOM if the Part Type field is set to Production in the item master.
When an item is entered manually and if it has its own master BOM, this can be transferred to the document BOM by clicking Request BOM from Line from the ribbon.
• If the Part Type field is set to Standard, then the item is treated as in the standard.
• If the Part Type field is set to Purchase and the status of a Document BOM changes to Released, a new Variant Code gets inserted to the Variant Code field in the BOM line.

trans-unit.source: If the Information Lines check box is selected for the BOM type in the document BOM configuration, then the components from items with the Part Type field <> Standard or Purchase are also copied into the document BOM.

seg-source.mrk: If the Information Lines check box is selected for the BOM type in the document BOM configuration, then the components from items with the Part Type field <> Standard or Purchase are also copied into the document BOM.

trans-unit.source: Resource – Enables a resource to be selected. The use of resources in the master BOM is meaningful if the capacity and value of indirect areas (e.g. construction) are also to be considered in the BOM.

seg-source.mrk: Resource – Enables a resource to be selected.
The use of resources in the master BOM is meaningful if the capacity and value of indirect areas (e.g. construction) are also to be considered in the BOM.

trans-unit.source: Work Center – Selection of a work center for a series of operations.

seg-source.mrk: Work Center – Selection of a work center for a series of operations.

trans-unit.source: Machine Center – Selection of a machine center for a series of operations.

seg-source.mrk: Machine Center – Selection of a machine center for a series of operations.

trans-unit.source: Master BOM – Selection of another Master BOM. The components of this Master BOM will not be transferred in as its own assembly group, but will be copied directly into the current BOM level.

seg-source.mrk: Master BOM – Selection of another Master BOM.
The components of this Master BOM will not be transferred in as its own assembly group, but will be copied directly into the current BOM level.

trans-unit.source: Production BOM – Used with the integration to cc|process manufacturing (refer to section “cc|process manufacturing” on page 1.

seg-source.mrk: Production BOM – Used with the integration to cc|process manufacturing (refer to section “cc|process manufacturing” on page 1.

trans-unit.source: No.

seg-source.mrk: No.

trans-unit.source: Number of the relevant item, resource, work center, machine center, master BOM, or G/L account.

seg-source.mrk: Number of the relevant item, resource, work center, machine center, master BOM, or G/L account.

trans-unit.source: Description – Description 5

seg-source.mrk: Description – Description 5

trans-unit.source: Descriptions from the Item Card. These descriptions are copied into the master BOM and can be changed here as required.

seg-source.mrk: Descriptions from the Item Card.
These descriptions are copied into the master BOM and can be changed here as required.

trans-unit.source: Calculation Group Code

seg-source.mrk: Calculation Group Code

trans-unit.source: Groups items, work centers, machine centers, resources, or G/L accounts for calculation purposes (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Calculation Groups in Order.htm#_Ref310435968" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculation Groups in Order-Related BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Groups items, work centers, machine centers, resources, or G/L accounts for calculation purposes (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Calculation Groups in Order.htm#_Ref310435968" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculation Groups in Order-Related BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Routing Link Code

seg-source.mrk: Routing Link Code

trans-unit.source: This code is used to connect material with a series of operations. In cc|configure to order, this code is used to assign material provided for an external manufacturing step.

seg-source.mrk: This code is used to connect material with a series of operations.
In cc|configure to order, this code is used to assign material provided for an external manufacturing step.

trans-unit.source: Standard Task Code

seg-source.mrk: Standard Task Code

trans-unit.source: Indicates the Standard Task Code for the document BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the Standard Task Code for the document BOM line.

trans-unit.source: Enclosure

seg-source.mrk: Enclosure

trans-unit.source: Indicates material provided for external processing.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates material provided for external processing.

trans-unit.source: Enclosure Drop Shipment

seg-source.mrk: Enclosure Drop Shipment

trans-unit.source: Indicates material provided for external processing that must be drop shipped to the vendor.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates material provided for external processing that must be drop shipped to the vendor.

trans-unit.source: Variant Code

seg-source.mrk: Variant Code

trans-unit.source: Number of the item variant if a variant item is selected.

seg-source.mrk: Number of the item variant if a variant item is selected.

trans-unit.source: Text Set ID

seg-source.mrk: Text Set ID

trans-unit.source: Indicates the ID of any text from the cc|text module that has been entered for the document BOM line (refer to topic “cc|text module” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the ID of any text from the cc|text module that has been entered for the document BOM line (refer to topic “cc|text module” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Copy BOM to Text

seg-source.mrk: Copy BOM to Text

trans-unit.source: Determines if the BOM will be copied to the purchase line text for a purchased item that is internally designed (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Purchasing of Internally Designed.htm#_Ref310330883" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Purchasing of Internally Designed Items” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the BOM will be copied to the purchase line text for a purchased item that is internally designed (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Purchasing of Internally Designed.htm#_Ref310330883" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Purchasing of Internally Designed Items” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Exp. Quantity

seg-source.mrk: Exp.
Quantity

trans-unit.source: Indicates the number if components needed to manufacture an assembly.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the number if components needed to manufacture an assembly.

trans-unit.source: For example, if on a higher-level line, the Calculation Formula field is empty and you type a value in the Quantity per field, the Quantity field on the lower-level line will be populated with the same value. The Exp. Quantity field on the lower-level line is then calculated by multiplying the Exp. Quantity on the higher-level line by the Quantity field on the component line.

seg-source.mrk: For example, if on a higher-level line, the Calculation Formula field is empty and you type a value in the Quantity per field, the Quantity field on the lower-level line will be populated with the same value.
The <span class="Bold">Exp.
Quantity field on the lower-level line is then calculated by multiplying the Exp.
Quantity on the higher-level line by the Quantity field on the component line.

trans-unit.source: For work centers and machine centers, this field is used for calculating the time requirement according to the following formula:

seg-source.mrk: For work centers and machine centers, this field is used for calculating the time requirement according to the following formula:

trans-unit.source: Time requirement = Tr + Te/Lot size * Exp. Quantity

seg-source.mrk: Time requirement = Tr + Te/Lot size * Exp.
Quantity

trans-unit.source: Calculation Formula

seg-source.mrk: Calculation Formula

trans-unit.source: Determines how the Quantity field is calculated. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines how the Quantity field is calculated.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: <blank>

seg-source.mrk: <blank>

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Length

seg-source.mrk: Length

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Length * Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Length * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Length * Width

seg-source.mrk: Length * Width

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Length * Width * Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Length * Width * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Length * Width * Depth

seg-source.mrk: Length * Width * Depth

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Length * Width * Depth * Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Length * Width * Depth * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Weight

seg-source.mrk: Weight

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Weight * Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Weight * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Identifies a quantity per value; functions the same as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies a quantity per value; functions the same as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Quantity

seg-source.mrk: Quantity

trans-unit.source: Shows the quantity, which is needed by the component to manufacture a unit of a higher-level item. This field is automatically updated based on the Quantity per field and – if the Calculation Formula field was filled in – the values in the Length, Width, Weight and/or Depth fields.

seg-source.mrk: Shows the quantity, which is needed by the component to manufacture a unit of a higher-level item.
This field is automatically updated based on the Quantity per field and – if the Calculation Formula field was filled in – the values in the Length, Width, Weight and/or Depth fields.

Quantity Unit of Measure

Quantity field.

trans-unit.source: Starting Date

seg-source.mrk: Starting Date

trans-unit.source: The start date is calculated via the scheduling. In the case of series of operations (Type is set to Work Center, Machine Center or Resource) the start date of the series of operations is entered here. The field can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: The start date is calculated via the scheduling.
In the case of series of operations (Type is set to Work Center, Machine Center or Resource) the start date of the series of operations is entered here.
The field can be changed manually.

trans-unit.source: Ending Date

seg-source.mrk: Ending Date

trans-unit.source: The end date is calculated via the scheduling. In the case of series of operations (Type is set to Work Center, Machine Center or Resource) the end date of the series of operations is entered here. The field can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: The end date is calculated via the scheduling.
In the case of series of operations (Type is set to Work Center, Machine Center or Resource) the end date of the series of operations is entered here.
The field can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: Due Date

In the case of items, the due date of the components is entered here.
The field can be changed manually.

trans-unit.source: Information Line

seg-source.mrk: Information Line

trans-unit.source: Corresponds to the Part Type field on the Item Card (Refer to topic "Config. to Order FastTab" on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Corresponds to the Part Type field on the Item Card (Refer to topic "Config. to Order FastTab" on page 1).

trans-unit.source: If the item has a Part Type set to Production, it is not relevant for requirements itself, but is relevant for its sub-items. In this case, the Information Line check box is selected. This check box is not selected for the sub-items.

In this case, the Information Line check box is selected.
This check box is not selected for the sub-items.

trans-unit.source: Sub BOM

Any master or manufacturing BOM that exists for the item is not displayed.

trans-unit.source: Order Tracking Relevance

seg-source.mrk: Order Tracking Relevance

trans-unit.source: System-internal field used for calculations within requirements planning.

seg-source.mrk: System-internal field used for calculations within requirements planning.

trans-unit.source: Schedule Manually

seg-source.mrk: Schedule Manually

trans-unit.source: If selected, the line is not included in the “Schedule” function.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the line is not included in the “Schedule” function.

trans-unit.source: Line Discount %

seg-source.mrk: Line Discount %

trans-unit.source: The line discount percentage that is valid for the item on the line.

seg-source.mrk: The line discount percentage that is valid for the item on the line.

trans-unit.source: Line Discount Amount

seg-source.mrk: Line Discount Amount

trans-unit.source: The amount of the line discount.

seg-source.mrk: The amount of the line discount.

trans-unit.source: Shipment Date

seg-source.mrk: Shipment Date

trans-unit.source: The date on which the component must be available. This date is calculated from the “Schedule” function of the document BOM or construction order. Generally, it is dependent on the start date of the series of operations (refer to the Starting Date field). The value proposed by the system can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: The date on which the component must be available.
This date is calculated from the “Schedule” function of the document BOM or construction order.
Generally, it is dependent on the start date of the series of operations (refer to the Starting Date field).
The value proposed by the system can be changed manually.

trans-unit.source: Production Lead Time

seg-source.mrk: Production Lead Time

trans-unit.source: A lead time can be entered here. When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here is taken over as the lead time for the component in the production order.

seg-source.mrk: A lead time can be entered here.
When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here is taken over as the lead time for the component in the production order.

trans-unit.source: Scrap %

seg-source.mrk: Scrap %

trans-unit.source: A scrap percentage can be entered here. When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here for the component is transferred into the Scrap % field on the production order.

seg-source.mrk: A scrap percentage can be entered here.
When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here for the component is transferred into the Scrap % field on the production order.

trans-unit.source: Base Material

seg-source.mrk: Base Material

trans-unit.source: A base material can be entered here. If a base material is already assigned to the item card, it will default to the document BOM when created.

seg-source.mrk: A base material can be entered here.
If a base material is already assigned to the item card, it will default to the document BOM when created.

trans-unit.source: Production View Link

seg-source.mrk: Production View Link

trans-unit.source: Identifies the production view code for the assembly unit that will be linked to the component (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157701" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the production view code for the assembly unit that will be linked to the component (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157701" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Belongs to Prod. View Link

seg-source.mrk: Belongs to Prod.
View Link

trans-unit.source: Indicates which assembly unit this component is linked to and thus will become part of its configuration when viewing the construction order in the production view (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157708" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates which assembly unit this component is linked to and thus will become part of its configuration when viewing the construction order in the production view (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157708" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Constr. Inquiry Exists

seg-source.mrk: Constr.
Inquiry Exists

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a construction inquiry exists for this line (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Construction Inquiry.htm#_Ref351128460" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Construction Inquiry” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether a construction inquiry exists for this line (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Construction Inquiry.htm#_Ref351128460" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Construction Inquiry” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Separate Delivery

seg-source.mrk: Separate Delivery

trans-unit.source: Determines if the component is planned for a separate delivery (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Separate Delivery of Semi.htm#_Ref277407232" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Separate Delivery of Semi-Finished Goods” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the component is planned for a separate delivery (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Separate Delivery of Semi.htm#_Ref277407232" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Separate Delivery of Semi-Finished Goods” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Purchase Exists

seg-source.mrk: Purchase Exists

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether there is an open purchase order or requisition line for a G/L account (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440211" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether there is an open purchase order or requisition line for a G/L account (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440211" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Purchase Status

seg-source.mrk: Purchase Status

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a purchase order or requisition line for a G/L account or component has been created or has been posted (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440217" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether a purchase order or requisition line for a G/L account or component has been created or has been posted (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440217" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Changed

seg-source.mrk: Changed

trans-unit.source: Indicates if something within the Document BOM has changed (e.g., a dummy item is replaced by a selected item or the Document BOM has been changed since the Document BOM page was opened).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates if something within the Document BOM has changed (e.g., a dummy item is replaced by a selected item or the Document BOM has been changed since the Document BOM page was opened).

trans-unit.source: Operation No. / Previous Operation No. / Next Operation No.

seg-source.mrk: Operation No.
/ Previous Operation No.
/ Next Operation No.

trans-unit.source: Offers the same function as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV routings. In the Document BOM line, these fields only work if Type = Work Center or Machine Center.

seg-source.mrk: Offers the same function as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV routings.
In the Document BOM line, these fields only work if Type = Work Center or Machine Center.

trans-unit.source: Refer to <MadCap:xref href="Example Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to <MadCap:xref href="Example Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Parallel Operation No.

seg-source.mrk: Parallel Operation No.

trans-unit.source: Provides a simplified process for defining parallel routings (refer to <MadCap:xref href="Example Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Provides a simplified process for defining parallel routings (refer to <MadCap:xref href="Example Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Transfer to Sales Document

seg-source.mrk: Transfer to Sales Document

trans-unit.source: Determines if the Document BOM (where Type = Item) will be transferred to the current Sales Quote/Order lines (refer to topic “Example – Transfer Components to Sales Order” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the Document BOM (where Type = Item) will be transferred to the current Sales Quote/Order lines (refer to topic “Example – Transfer Components to Sales Order” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Type Production Structure

trans-unit.source: Used with the integration to cc|process manufacturing (refer to section “cc|process manufacturing” on page 1.
